results.title: A Different approach
results.creator_credit: Fern Field, Jim Belcher and Belfern Productions
results.brief_description: A young filmmaker, hired to make a sombre straight-forward film about the reasons employers should hire the disabled, decides instead to take an innovative, irreverent approach to what is usually a piously hush-hush subject. The film shows him screening his film to an incredulous audience and trying to convince them that his different approach is the right one. Stars Michael Keaton with cameo appearances by Martin Mull, Ed Asner, Jim Nabors and Carroll O’Connor.

results.title: A Day in June: Montreal
results.creator_credit: Louis Portugais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: June 24th is celebrated in Montreal with parade and fanfare in memory of St. Jean Baptiste, the patron saint of Quebec. Now more of an historical than a religeous pageant, the “grande parade” consists of a series of tableaux on floats representing events from French Canada’s colourful past. Using candid camera techniques, the film captures the reactions and behaviour of people participating in a public festivity dear to their hearts. Contains some spoken French language.

results.title: A Dog's world
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnstone, Louise Jones, Channel 4 and Wall to Wall Television
results.brief_description: This program looks at the evolution of the dog as a companion animal and the adaptions dogs have made from their wolf-like existence as pack animals. We see how they use their keen sense of smell, hearing, and sensitivity to movement, combined with their territorial and protective behaviours in order to coexist happily with their human families.

results.title: A Desperate fortune: Matthew Flinders' Australia
results.creator_credit: Antony J. Bowman, Jack Smith and A to Z Communications
results.brief_description: A documentary style drama depicting the life and times of one of Australia’s greatest explorers. Matthew Flinders was the first man to circumnavigate the vast island continent known in the 18th century as New Holland. However few people are aware that he was also the first person to formally name it Australia. This is not simply a story of an extraordinary man’s courage and perseverance throughout a series of arduous voyages, but a romantic adventure fraught with all the inevitable dangers and excitement of conquering an untamed land. Narrated by Edward Woodward.

results.title: A Decade under the influence
results.creator_credit: Ted Demme, Richard LaGravenese, Jerry Kupfer, Gini Reticker and Independent Film Channel
results.brief_description: The 1970s was a revolutionary time for cinema; coming off the domineering era of the studio system, a new breed of filmmakers emerged with their own agendas, styles and stories to tell. Men such as Coppola, Scorsese, Hopper, Bogdanovich, Friedkin, Pollack, Cassevetes and Altman, transformed the industry with their raw and un-compromising stories that revelled not in escapism, but in realism, tackling such issues as the Vietnam War, the sexual revolution and their generation’s disenchantment with the false ideals and corruptness of society. Using clips from an array of films, and a slew of interviews with key players from the time, this documentary presents a thorough (but by no means exhaustive) and entertaining overview of the period, ending with the introduction of the first blockbusters of the 1970s “Jaws” and “Star Wars”. Interviewees include Martin Scorsese, Francis Ford Coppola, William Friedkin, Sydney Pollack, Ellen Burstyn, Julie Christie, Robert Altman, Dennis Hopper, Paul Schrader, Pam Grier, Jon Voight and Bruce Dern.

results.title: A Day in the life of a child: introducing environmental action
results.creator_credit: Stephen Weingarth, Tim Cramer and Educational and Documentary Video Productions
results.brief_description: Filmed in Australia, this program combines acting, animation and real life environmental situations in homes, schools and communities. Demonstrates how young people can think and act in an environmentally friendly manner and have fun as well.

results.title: A Critical guide to the metaphysical poets
results.creator_credit: Chris Gormlie, Vanessa Tovell and Cromwell Productions
results.brief_description: This documentary, about the metaphysical poets of the 17th century, is a mixture of historical recreations and interviews. Although about an array of poets, the focus is primarily on John Donne, a renowned poet, whose elegant musings on love, religion and spirituality garnered him great favour with the rulers of the day. The metaphysical poets operated in a time of great upheaval in society. Advances in science meant that long held beliefs were being challenged; indeed this period saw the shift from Medieval to modern. The metaphysical poets specialised in verse that celebrated physical and romantic love, but also combined these sentiments with thoughts on spirituality, government and state, and changes being wrought in society.

results.title: A Day in the death of Joe Egg
results.creator_credit: Peter Medak, David Deutsch, Domino and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Alan Bates and Janet Suzman give exceptional performances in this unforgettable story. Based on the play by Peter Nichols, it centres around Bri and Sheila, an English couple struggling to cope with and raise their only child - a severely handicapped young girl named Jo with whom they cannot communicate. Much to the dismay of friends and relatives, who continually recommend having Jo institutionalised, the couple choose to care for their daughter in their own modest apartment. Although they try to maintain their sense of humour, the difficulty and the seeming futility of their efforts takes an emotional toll that eventually threatens to destroy their marriage. A vivid portrait of two caring individuals faced with an almost impossible situation.

results.title: A Dangerous life
results.creator_credit: R. Markowitz, Hal McElroy and McElroy & McElroy
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the four day revolution in the Philippines. Told through the eyes of a television reporter and photojournalist, it backgrounds the struggle that led to the 1986 revolution which saw Aquino become president succeeding the ousted Ferdinand Marcos.

results.title: A Crowded wilderness
results.creator_credit: Grant Kennedy, Roger Hart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Spacious, limitless as they may seem, Canada’s National Parks may not be able to keep up with the demands made on their resources without a continuing program of extending the parks system. Wilderness may, in fact, be the greatest heritage this generation of Canadians can leave to future generations. The problems, and the need to act now, are well defined in this film by concerned conservationists.
